messageBody:
The reason I asked if you needed to call it repeatedly is that if you had a method foo(x, y), and just needed to call it once, I would just call it from a separate test method:

@Test
public void testFoo() {
  assertEquals(someValue, foo(3, 5)); 
}

Even if you have a small number of ways you want to call it, this can be scalable:

@Test public void testFooOn3And5() {
  assertEquals(someValue, foo(3, 5)); 
}

@Test public void testFooOn6and6() {
   assertEquals(anotherValue, foo(6, 6));
}

etc.

Until you get above 5 or 6 different parameter groups, this is probably less work than any of the existing automated parameterized testing techniques.

   David Saff
